sentence.Network_en: My father died very suddenly and very tragically.
sentence.Network_cn: 我父亲的死非常突然，非常不幸。

sentence.Network_en: Their daughter was tragically killed in a road accident.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们的女儿不幸死于车祸.

sentence.Network_en: Her father died tragically in a car crash.
sentence.Network_cn: 她父亲在一场车祸中惨死.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 高考链接(70108)-高三英语阅读(430)-21英语网 ... mission n. 使命，任务 tragically adv. 悲剧地，悲惨地 crash v./n. 坠毁，碰撞.
tragical 悲剧的tragically 悲剧地tragicomedy 悲喜剧
Brooke Astor's last days remind us how tragically vulnerable the old can be , even when wealthy and surrounded by retainers .布鲁克·阿斯特夫人最后的一段日子告诉我们，一个老人可以是多么的脆弱和不幸，即使他家财万贯，即使他有再多的仆人。

tragically , when I got knocked off my bicycle a while ago , I must have damaged the exact part of the brain that is used to cajole Chinese diplomatic staff into issuing visas .富有悲剧意味的是，前一段时间我从自行车上摔下来，大脑里用来哄骗中国外交官给我颁发签证的那一部分细胞一定被摔坏了。

list.abs: 如我们所俗知，悲剧的人物被称之为悲剧英雄（tragic hero），在古典悲剧中，乃是地位崇高的人物，一般为王侯将相等负有重大责任 …
tragedy 悲剧tragic atmosphere 悲剧气氛tragic conflict 悲剧性冲突
这就是此类角色性格上的悲剧性缺陷(tragic flaw)。 ■

entry.def: A tragic event or situation is extremely sad, usually because it involves death or suffering.

example.ex: It was just a tragic accident...
…the tragic loss of so many lives…

entry.def: Tragic is used to refer to tragedy as a type of literature.

example.ex: ...Michael Henchard, the tragic hero of 'The Mayor of Casterbridge'.
example.tran: 迈克尔·亨察德，《卡斯特桥市长》的悲剧主人公

means.word_mean: 1. in a tragic manner; with tragic consequences;
